Protocol-independent options are negotiated by LCP. Network Control Protocol (NCP) A separate NCP is used to negotiate the configuration o f each network layer protocol (such as IP) carried by PPP. debug ppp { negotiation | packet } PPP Header Address Control Protocol 8 16 24 32 Connection Phase Flowchart Dead Establish Authenticate Network Terminate Auth Required No Auth Success Failure Admin Shutdown Authentication Protocols Plaintext Authentication Protocol (PAP) Original, obsolete authentication protocol which relie s on the exchange of a plaintext key to authenticate peers (RFC 1334). Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) Authenticates peers using the MD5 checksum of a pre-shared secret key (RFC 1994).
